snippet: The government presented evidence that executives of big book publishing companies discussed raising e-book prices at Apple’s behest before the introduction of the iPad.
abstract: Justice Department, in antitrust case against Apple, says there were 100 phone calls among top executives of publishing industry in weeks leading up to Apple's iPad introduction in 2010, when they had to decide whether to sign on to deal with firm that would raise prices of e-books.
lead_paragraph: The government presented evidence that executives of big book publishing companies discussed raising e-book prices at Apple’s behest before the introduction of the iPad.

headline.main: U.S. Cites Phone Calls in Apple Pricing Case
headline.print_headline: U.S. Cites Phone Calls In Apple Pricing Case
